*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Saucedo, July 17, 1826. Reporting attack on Gonzales by Comanche and Tahuacano Indians.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*I conceive it to be my duty to inform your *person_mentioned*Lordship*/person_mentioned*, that, a few days since, a parcy of about sixty *person_mentioned*Comanche */person_mentioned*and *person_mentioned*Tahuacano Indians*/person_mentioned*, visited the *location_mentioned*settlement */location_mentioned*of the *person_mentioned*Empresario, Green De Witt*/person_mentioned*. In the town of *location_mentioned*Gonzales */location_mentioned*in the *location_mentioned*Guadalupe*/location_mentioned*, they *person_mentioned*killed */person_mentioned*one man and *person_mentioned*wounded*/person_mentioned* another; they destroyed all the furniture of *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Mr Kerr*/person_mentioned*'s house*/location_mentioned*, and stole all the horses they could find. The *person_mentioned*settlers */person_mentioned*retreated to this *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned*, not knowing what to do; they had a certain quantity of corn sowed, and, but for this unfortunate occurrence, their *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*would be in a very thriving condition.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr Kerr*/person_mentioned* was absent at the time; so soon as he heard of it he returned to *location_mentioned*Gonzales */location_mentioned*with a *person_mentioned*party */person_mentioned*of men from *location_mentioned*Colorado*/location_mentioned*. The *person_mentioned*Indians */person_mentioned*have disappeared, and he writes to me that he will shortly go to *location_mentioned*Bexar*/location_mentioned*, to make his report to your *person_mentioned*Lordship*/person_mentioned*, in person.*/p*
*p*God and Liberty*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Stephen F. Austin*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin*/location_mentioned*, *date_mentioned n="07-17-1826">July 17th, 1826*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*/div1*
